title: High-quality Scanning Electron Microscopy Incorporated with a Freeze-drying and Gaseous Nitrogen-based Approach for Cell-extracellular Vesicle Interactions
content: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) has offer unique capability for viewing the fine ultrastructure associated with external cellular boundaries, while water-rich (âˆ¼80% by volume) cells surrounded by a lipid-rich membrane present a challenge in achieving optimal preservation of topography at high resolution due to the requirement for dehydration and maintenance of membrane fatty acids without compromising membrane properties. Early days of SEM protocols using ethanol resulted in suboptimal preservation of membranes [1, 2]. Application of osmium tetra-oxide (OsO4) [3] and lowering the temperature of reagents [4] medicate the viewing cytoarchitecture.
